elements.content: As of now, our HTML documents look quite bland. This is because it contains only text, without styling. CSS allows us to add awesome effects, colors, sizes, and more to our websites.
CSS stands for [[b]]C[[/]]ascading [[b]]S[[/]]tyle [[b]]S[[/]]heets. CSS does not write any new content to the website, but is solely for styling.
Selectors identify the element being styled. Styles are added in a [[monospace]]key: value[[/]] pattern
You can select HTML elements by class name, element name or id name.
Pseudo selectors allow you to add styles when elements are in a certain state.
CSS files must be added through the link tag in the HTML head.
The class and id attributes allow you to control HTML elements by adding style to a specific element or group of elements. HTML also provides some ways to write CSS in HTML files.
font-family: Change the font of an element.
font-size: Change the size of an element.
text-align: Center, left or right align text.
color: Change the color of text.
text-decoration: Add underlines, strikethroughs and other decorations.
Draw borders around elements.
Box shadows apply an offset shadow to different elements. They are often used to how hovers. They follow the structure of [[monospace]]box-shadow:  X-offset Y-offset blur-radius  color;[[/]].

Custom colors allow you to combine amounts of red, blue, green, and optionally alpha (opacity) to create colors. They follow the structure of [[monospace]]color: rgb(red, green, blue, alpha)[[/]]. The values parameters must be a number from 0 - 255.
The gradient style can be used to give elements a gradient effect. They follow the structure of [[monospace]]background-image: linear-gradient(direction, list of colors)[[/]].
/data/modules/webdev-assets/img3/5-2.png
Selector events allow CSS properties to activate on events, like a hover.
Animation transitions allow you to apply smoother transitions to elements.
- 1 second transition to all styles: [[monospace]]transition: 1s all[[/]]
- 1 second transition to a specific style option: [[monospace]]transition: 1s color[[/]]
- Multiple transition rules: [[monospace]]transition: 1s color, 3s border[[/]]

Bootstrap is a CSS framework that makes the creation of layouts simpler. It comes with pre-built CSS classes, to save programmers time when using CSS. It comes with support for mobile and desktop screens.
To import bootstrap into HTML...
1. Navigate to Bootstrap's documentation: [[a]]https://getbootstrap.com/docs/5.0/getting-started/download/#cdn-via-jsdelivr[[/a]].
2. Copy the two tags under CDN via jsDelivr and add them to your HTML code (use the copy button in the corner)

<link href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap@5.0.2/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css" rel="stylesheet" integrity="sha384-EVSTQN3/azprG1Anm3QDgpJLIm9Nao0Yz1ztcQTwFspd3yD65VohhpuuCOmLASjC" crossorigin="anonymous">
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap@5.0.2/dist/js/bootstrap.bundle.min.js" integrity="sha384-MrcW6ZMFYlzcLA8Nl+NtUVF0sA7MsXsP1UyJoMp4YLEuNSfAP+JcXn/tWtIaxVXM" crossorigin="anonymous"></script>

elements.text: Bootstrap contains CSS files, just like any website.

elements.content: .class-name {property: “value”; property2: “value2”}
Notice the link tag? This Imports CSS from a file with styled classes. You can apply Bootstrap classes to HTML tags instead of rewriting CSS code. This can speed up development and efficiency

Another useful feature of Bootstrap is the grid system. The grid system allows for efficient placement of HTML elements. It consists of 12 column units. For example, if you want an element to cover half of the screen, use 6 units. Set the class attribute to [[monospace]]col-[units][[/]] to set column of and element. Bootstrap's grid consists of rows that divide columns, as well.
- Element with class [[monospace]]form-control[[/]] enables bootstrap form features.
- Bootstrap enables easy sizing of form elements by setting the class [[monospace]]form-control-[size][[/]].
- The available sizes are "lg" for large, nothing for normal, and "sm" for small.
- The [[monospace]]inline[[/]] class allows multiple elements to be displayed on one line.
- The class [[monospace]]form-group[[/]] provides structures for groups by grouping form elements. They are useful when there are several sections of forms.
